column4: All people around here NEVER have a problem with Tcl/Tk fonts appearance ????
This is a total off-the-cuff suggestion, but try running "sudo dpkg-reconfigure fontconfig" or fontconfig-config.
I had shitty terminal fonts until I ran that and selected "enable Bitmap fonts"
I used Xfce for a while but I didn't like its file manager, and it was missing a few other things too
Now it have Thunar as default, many better
I really prefer gnome and kde over xfce, but this is not my home machine
I might try Xfce again some day.  Right now I'm rocking out on KDE.
Is English your second language?  There are other chatrooms for several languages, you know.
If you want to send someone a private message, type: "/msg username message message message"
Most people come here for Questions & Answers, so you can just ask your question and wait for someone to type your name in a response, or keep a lookout for questions you know how to answer.
I had enabled bitmapped fonts, and don't help
Sorry man... that was my only idea.
What i want to do is change the fonts like I do in gtk, or mess with some kind of xresource
You know as well as I do.  I don't know anything about fonts, really.
I will try in another places, and wait more time here seeing the posts, its very good to may help in something
